text: The Mutual Broadcasting System was an American radio network. It broadcast radio shows from 1934 to 1999. It was also called Mutual Broadcasting Company; Mutual; or the Mutual Broadcasting System, Inc. Mutual broadcast radio shows, such as The Lone Ranger, The Adventures of Superman, and The Shadow. It broadcast baseball games, including the All-Star Game and World Series, and football games for the University of Notre Dame. From 1978 to 1994, it broadcast the Larry King Show. ==References== Category:Media in the United States Category:American entertainment companies Category:Peabody Award winners Category:1934 establishments in the United States Category:1999 disestablishments in the United States
title: Mutual Broadcasting System
